intro: Cryptantha grayi var. genuina, commonly known as the California gilia, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, blue to purple flowers that bloom in late spring. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has slender stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Cryptantha grayi var. genuina is an important nectar source for pollinators like bees and butterflies.
